description: Describe previous term from the right (method B - initial term is 3).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..21
example: E.g. the term after 1131 is obtained by saying "1 once, 3 once, 1 twice", which gives 113112.
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (group, transpose)a022514 n = a022514_list !! na022514_list = 3 : f [3] :: [Integer] where   f xs = (read $ concatMap show ys) : f ys where          ys = concat $ transpose [map head zss, map length zss]          zss = reverse $ group xs-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 26 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _Patrick De Geest_, Jun 15 1999.
